France unveils $8.8 billion rescue for ailing car industry ...  billion) plan to save the country's car industry from huge losses wrought by virus lockdowns, including a big boost for electric vehicles. The plan includes government subsidies for car buyers and longer-term investment in innovative technology, especially in battery-powered cars, said an AP report. "Our country wouldn't be the same without its great brands Renault, Peugeot, Citroen," Macron declared, and announcing a goal of making France the leading producer of "clean" cars in Europe. The 8 billion euros does not include a 5 billion-euro government loan guarantee under discussion for struggling Renault, or the millions the government has already spent on temporary unemployment payments to auto workers told to stay home for weeks to ...

France is sinking 8 billion euros into its car industry Photo: AFP / FRANCOIS LO PRESTI France, the home of Renault, Citroen and Peugeot, has seen car sales and revenue slashed by some 80 percent as a result of a two-month nationwide lockdown to curb the spread of the coronavirus, said Macron. By the end of June, some half a million cars will have gone unsold. "This has never been seen by this sector which represents close to 16 percent of the revenue of our industrial sector," said the president ...

France to give ailing car industry $8.8 billion rescue ...  at a crucial time for carmaker Renault, which came into the virus crisis in particularly bad shape after the 2018 arrest of its longtime star CEO Carlos Ghosn. The French finance minister warned that the company's survival is at stake, and Renault and Nissan have scheduled an announcement Wednesday that is expected to address the future of their alliance. PSA Group, which makes Peugeot and Citroen cars, came into the crisis in better shape, after years of cost-cutting under CEO Carlos Tavares. PSA reported record profits last year, but has also seen sales plunge amid virus lockdowns. It is in the process of merging with Fiat Chrysler Automobiles to create the world's fourth-largest auto maker. The French government owns a 12% stake in PSA through ...

France unveils $8.8 billion rescue for ailing car industry ...  the carmaker will cut 2 billion euros ($2.2 billion) in costs, and expect that will lead to factory closures and job losses in France.
